title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at South University (Columbia, SC)
Interview Descriptions: First interview, then interview with multiple department heads. Questions are standard and they are open to people from all different backgrounds. I enjoyed the experience and felt like it helped me grow in my skills.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at South University in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with an indeed virtual hiring day. Interview lasted maybe 5 minutes. I was not told anything about the job only that I’ll get an email to move on to the next steps. Felt very unprofessional and was told straight up that there were several candidates and only a few spots. Gave me the feeling of a very competitive work space. Didn’t feel like a personal experience at all I can see why this university has such bad reviews… asked me only two or three questions and didn’t provide any details what so ever about the company.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? Do you have any experience in sales?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at South University (Atlanta, GA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: What a joke. First interview over Zoom. I was in the exact same role with another online university for 11 years as a top performer. The interviewer said I would get an email in a couple days to schedule a follow-up. Never received any more communication, not even a generic reply. No way to reach back out to them.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience.

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at South University
Interview Descriptions: I was briefly interviewed over the phone, then I had to come in for a 15 minute presentation on a topic in my area of expertise. From there, I spoke to the group as they had a chance to ask me questions. Then I interviewed with the campus president, and I was offered the position the next day.
Interview Questions: Had to provide a 15 minute presentation to faculty.

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at South University
Interview Descriptions: Applied via indeed and heard back pretty quickly, after a typical initial video screen with the hiring manager I was ghosted. I can’t say I’m upset because the role wasn’t a great fit, but as a Talent Acquisition professional it’s just sad to not even get an automated thanks but no thanks.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your recruiting experience.

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at South University
Interview Descriptions: Two phone interviews. Simple conversations. Basic questions asked. Always a positive to use real examples. Got feedback quick. Entire process took about a week. Started the interview process because I was referred by an employee within the company.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little about yourself

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at South University in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and a coordinator reached out to schedule the interview. She only gave me one day with three afternoon options. That should've been a red flag, but I told her I was available whenever and she told a time for me. I interviewed with a manager in the talent acquisition department. I feel like she didn't like me and just went through the motions for the interview. I already knew I didn't get it after the call and got the standard rejection email about two weeks later. I could tell she didn't read my resume because she was asking me questions that were on there already. She asked me why I was leaving my company when my resume in bold said laid off next to the company's name. I dodged a bullet with this company.
Interview Questions: What do you know about us?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at South University (Muskegon, MI) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a virtual hiring event through indeed. The manager did not tell me anything about the position, he just asked me about myself and told me that the job was remote and if I had internet connect capability. Then he stated that someone would be in contact with me about next steps. As much as I want this position, I kind of felt that I was left in limbo.
Interview Questions: Why did I apply to the position? Do I have internet capability?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at South University
Interview Descriptions: Very simple, interviewed with two managers over a 30 minute process, went over my work history and the role of the receptionist as well as an overview of the company as a whole. The interview was enlightening and fun. I enjoyed speaking with the 2 managers about the job and the culture of south university
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself , why do you want to work at south

title: Business Support Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at South University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with HR personnel then two in persons interviews with hiring manager and leadership team. Was called awhile after I applied but the hiring process was quick after that.
Interview Questions: Why are you the best fit for the position

title: Financial Aid Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at South University (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: You have to complete about four to five interviews total. The process is really drawn out and long. It can take about a month and a half to actually secure the job.
Interview Questions:
Do you work well with teams?
What do you know about the financial aid process?
Tell me a little more about yourself.
& more standard questions.

title: Full Time Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at South University (West Palm Beach, FL) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Wonderful experience interviewing here.  Felt at ease and instantly knew it was a great job fit for me. They want you to discuss yourself, your qualifications, but also your interests.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the next 5 years, if you take this job?

title: Admission Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at South University (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews. Ask a lot about how motivated you are. How do you deal with adversity? What made you apply for this job. It was decent. There was slit of questions but no too bad.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 6 months with the company

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at South University
Interview Descriptions: It was a done via a phone call. Two people were on the phone call and each person took turns asking questions. The interview lasted about 45 mins. What was most important to them during the interview were questions relating on how you would handle various situations about students, and the problems that may occur with them.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a student who isn't compliant?

title: Adjunct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at South University
Interview Descriptions: seemed like nice people however very outdated teaching pedagogy. The expectation is for the instructor to completely and overwhelmingly dominate the discussion boards by replying to each and every student and then replying repeatedly to every single comment made by every student. There is a wealth of research on distance learning and the value of discussion boards so it is mystifying how any institution would prescribe to a process that is the exact opposite to all current research.
Interview Questions: Not any questions, just verification that the instructor would follow odd policies

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at South University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online in January of 2020.  I was contacted the following day with a very positive phone call from a representative from the University.  I will complete the remainder of my interview process this upcoming week.
Interview Questions: What drew you to this position?

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at South University (Montgomery, AL) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: No interview at all. Submitted a resume along with a personal referral from currently employed staff and was offered a position. No questions about teaching experience or curricula development. Easy peasy.
Interview Questions: None. There was no interview.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at South University (Tampa, FL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Informed and very exact with discussion regarding my teaching  thoughts and philosophy regarding nursing in current state  
Areas of where I could teach in also nutrition courses  at the graduate level nursing courses
Interview Questions: Years of preceptor experience in nursing

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at South University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: They called and asked a couple questions. Then they schedule a Face to face then a phone interview. It’s was a pretty easy process. Just come prepared, and express you have a great attitude.
Interview Questions: How competitive are you?

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at South University (High Point, NC) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy interview. They are looking for qualifications and to see if you are a good fit. It is very corporate, so you want to dress the part.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at South University (High Point, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview for 30 minutes with hiring manager.  In person interview with hiring manager, then with entire team in one sitting, then alone with the President of the campus.
Interview Questions: Would you rather win, or if you failed would you be happy knowing you gave it your all?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at South University
Interview Descriptions: First a call from the recruiter, then an in-person interview with hiring manager. The biggest concern is that the recruiter and hiring manager told me two very different forms of compensation. I was told $19.23 an hour by the recruiter and then told $40,000 per year by the hiring manager. At 40 hours $19 is accurate but the hours are more like 50+ according to the hiring manager.
Interview Questions:
how do you handle an angry customer?
do you like working in a team?
do you have any questions?

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at South University
Interview Descriptions: Very brief, I answered basic questions about my experience, and I asked several questions about their processes and technologies.  Everything was very antiquated there were paper applications and a paper filing system.  There was no lead policy and people could go into each others databases with no notice.
Interview Questions: Years of experience

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at South University
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening, scheduled in-person interview, lengthy in-person interview with regional management personnel, scheduled follow-up interview with the President of the local campus. The in-person interview with the regional management personnel was lengthy, the majority of the interview felt like someone trying to sell me on the idea that a for-profit college was good/acceptable. The interviewer went to great lengths to explain the pending litigation and pending settlements of the parent corporation that owns/runs South.
Interview Questions:
1. Have you researched whether or not we are a for-profit or not-for-profit institute?
2. Are you aware of the pending litigation or settlements in process against our parent organization? 
3. Does the for-profit status of the organization bother you?
4. How would you feel about the position being more of a sales role in contrast to an "admissions counselor" type role, I.E. selling our "product" which is the education...

The normal interviews questions pertaining to what I bring to the table, my strengths and weaknesses, etc.

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at South University (Chandler, AZ) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter reached out to me, he conducted a "phone interview" which was less him asking me questions and more him telling me about the position. I then did an in person interview with my potential team manager. The final interview was a quick phone interview with the campus director.
Interview Questions: I want you to pretend that I am a student interested in studying business and talk to me about the school.

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at South University (Chandler, AZ) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: First, the recruiter, then the hiring manager.  The process was fairly standard.  The first interview was conducted over the phone, the second was directly with the gentleman who hired me. He was very cordial, and seemed to have a good outlook.  I enjoyed the interview.
Interview Questions:
What do you like about sales?
Do you enjoy a competitive sales environment?
What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at South University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had one in person interview followed by a phone interview where I role played a phone call I might make as an admissions representative. I was contacted by an HR representative before each interview and was allowed to ask questions and was given coaching and advice on how to successfully complete each step of the process.
Interview Questions: What do you do when faced with a difficult or rude customer in a customer service situation?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at South University (Savannah, GA)
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process it's easy longest you like  working with students and get involved with University. The President himself gave the interview and his secretary to care of the rest. 

It was nice experience.
Interview Questions: How would you help students?

title: Assistant Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at South University (Brandon, MS) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with HR, then Vice Chancellor, then Online Chairs and faculty.  I was told that I'd be hired by the Vice Chancellor -- the following interviews weren't necessary.  The entire process took more than 5 months.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work at South

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at South University (High Point, NC) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume and transcripts.  Provided references  and arranged a face to face interview with curriculum manager.  Completed professional  online training via previously taped videos.  Attended  classroom sessions  to observe students and student-teacher interaction.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with difficult students.

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at South University (Austin, TX) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took approximately 3 hours from start to finish. There were two rounds of interviews - one primarily with faculty and some staff and the other with executive staff (e.g. president, Dean, senior director of admissions, etc.).  Once you are finished with the interview, depending on the urgency, they normally respond within three days for an update.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked in a proprietary setting and if so, what are some differences between for-profit schools and your past experiences at other schools?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at South University (Gilbert, AZ) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview was easy, Jermaine was super nice, friendly, and helpful!!! Then scheduled an in person interview. I was expecting a panel/group interview when I arrived, but it ended up just being the manager I would be working for and me! This made me happy, because it is less stressful. We talked a lot about the job, and went through the interview questions ...but towards the end we were just talking about gardening and other hobbies we had in common! It was probably the most fun and comfortable interview I have ever been through... such a great experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you failed in your work:

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at South University (Savannah, GA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview. It was line apply and get in kinda thing. Not bad at all. There was no interview so there was no question or answer. If you apply and pass the drug test you will get in. The pay is good as well for work study. Have Fun.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Academic Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at South University (Austin, TX) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: The first step was submitting a resume and cover letter to the both Dean's for approval. After that, I met with the Dean of Academic Affairs and the Dean of Student Affairs together for the second part of the process. The interview was basic questions on certain job roles after that it was filtered into certain questions regarding South University.
Interview Questions: How would you handle highly confidential information?

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at South University
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews.  Pretty straight forward.  Some situational questions
Interview Questions: Tell us about your previous employer and why you are looking to switch

title: Sales Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at South University (Chandler, AZ) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Lots of steps, they move you from room to room, several mangers asking the same Q's. It takes several weeks and they bring about 50 people at the same time, group interview first.
Interview Questions: Why education? handle angry costumers? can you do 3 things at the same time.

title: Adjunct Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at South University (West Palm Beach, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Casual interview
Interview Questions: How I would manage classroom disruption

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at South University in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a call for a interview the next week.
Interview Questions: The only unexpected question was "What don't you like about your past employers?' Which

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at South University (Savannah, GA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Group panel, this was "talent search" type of interview with other candidates applying for same/similar positions. The setting was a classroom with about 30 other candidates. Seating was assigned. Campus president conducted the interview process which consisted of general HR questions in which candidates were randomly chosen to answer the questions. The interview process also included other directors from various other departments that had openings.
Interview Questions: How have did you handle or overcome a significant obstacle in your life

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at South University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online for adjunct online teaching position. Had previous experience teaching online.  Everything was conducted online. Forms were easy to fill out, everything went very quickly once they decided they wanted to hire me.
Interview Questions: none

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at South University (Chandler, AZ) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Applied for EDMC about an Admissions position.  I received a phone call soon after and spoke with the recruiter for a position with South University.  I soon received an email with a survey that I had to complete.  I completed the survey and then phoned the recruiter back.  He called me later and set up an interview with an Admissions manager.  He also sent an email with more application steps.  This all happened on the same day.

I went to the interview the next day with my completed application and had a brief interview that took all of 20 minutes from walking in to leaving the interview.  I then went home and wrote and mailed a thank you letter for the manager.  I was then scheduled for a role play interview on the phone with another manager that had to be rescheduled.   It was rescheduled with the same manager that interviewed me.  The call was short and I was done within 15 minutes. The next day I was contacted by the recruiter with an offer for the position.
Interview Questions: Nothing was difficult, I have worked in Higher Education for over five years.  If you have done student enrollment it is pretty standard questions. The part they were most interested in was overcoming objections from potential students and students.

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at South University (Chandler, AZ) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Includes initial interview and follow-up role play on phone as if you are helping student get info on classes.
Interview Questions: Had to overcome objections in mock interview such as, ' I am too busy to talk right now.' Had to continue w/ conversation as if were working with actual student.

title: Nursing Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at South University (Virginia Beach, VA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: 1:1 interview with the Director of the School of Nursing was uncomfortable because she was so all business, no personality. I took the job because I wanted to teach. I received information about the job that DID NOT come to fruition such as salary, expectations, no orientation process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at South University (Morehead City, NC) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Took place in a hotel
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at South University (West Palm Beach, FL) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: I personally walked in to South University and it gave off a nice clean office.  I met with the president's Assistant.  I filled my application out and interview with the president.  He is professionally and very nice.
Interview Questions: How did I feel about the hours, since they were from 12:00pm - 8:00pm.  How was my customer service skills.  I am very professional and happy helping other students and staff.

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at South University (Tampa, FL) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: Walked in and met with the Director. Set up for a panel interview a week later with the rest of the department.
Interview Questions: A lot of situational questions and questions based on fitting in with the team.

title: Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at South University (Richmond, VA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Called by their HR in Georgia... Asked questions.  Said everything sounded find...would get back to me... Was notified by the staffing recruiter (3rd party) that they declined me.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at South University (Savannah, GA) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: I met with 4 folks, individually.  The process took place over a couple of days.  They were very welcoming and asked thoughtful questions.  There was a lot of people in/around the area due to the location of everyone's offices so it felt like someone was always just outside the door, but there wasn't.
Interview Questions: What makes you excellent?

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at South University in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the library director first and then was called back to meet the campus president. After that, I was offered the job.
Interview Questions: What is on your bucket list?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at South University (Phoenix, AZ) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: Open house format.  Group presentation and collection of resumes.  The called names of people that they wanted to talk with further.  WE were then taken to a room with a phone bank and had to role play an inbound call.  then we waited to see if we were called again.  If you were called again, an individual interview with a hiring manager followed.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you can do this?  It seemed odd to ask that after I had cleared the telephone role play.
